result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Charles Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct.  DE pleads No Contest to amended charge.  Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:  40 days county jail, with Huber, with credit for 3 days.  Report to Jail on or before July 8th 2016 by 3:00 pm.   Fine/costs $579   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

Defendant Peter Charles Hall in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct.  DE pleads No Contest to amended charge.  Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:  40 days county jail, with Huber, with credit for 3 days.  Report to Jail on or before July 8th 2016 by 3:00 pm.   Fine/costs $579   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared in custody via video.  State appeared by Atty Marcoux.  SIBS at $500.00 no abusive contact with Carol DeMain.

No abusive Contact with  - Carol DeMain
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim " Carol DeMain   " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
